intro: Hieracium leptocranum, commonly known as the slender-headed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium leptocranum is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
